<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\file Execution Domain Fix pass.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Some X86 SSE instructions like mov, and, or, xor are available in different</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// variants for different operand types. These variant instructions are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// equivalent, but on Nehalem and newer cpus there is extra latency</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// transferring data between integer and floating point domains.  ARM cores</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// have similar issues when they are configured with both VFP and NEON</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// pipelines.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This pass changes the variant instructions to minimize domain crossings.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifndef LLVM&#95;CODEGEN&#95;EXECUTIONDOMAINFIX&#95;H</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define LLVM&#95;CODEGEN&#95;EXECUTIONDOMAINFIX&#95;H</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A DomainValue is a bit like LiveIntervals&#39; ValNo, but it also keeps track</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of execution domains.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// An open DomainValue represents a set of instructions that can still switch</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// execution domain. Multiple registers may refer to the same open</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// DomainValue - they will eventually be collapsed to the same execution</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// domain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A collapsed DomainValue represents a single register that has been forced</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// into one of more execution domains. There is a separate collapsed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// DomainValue for each register, but it may contain multiple execution</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// domains. A register value is initially created in a single execution</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// domain, but if we were forced to pay the penalty of a domain crossing, we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// keep track of the fact that the register is now available in multiple</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// domains.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue/#a765760aae1c271856a0249b1e617e334">DomainValue</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Basic reference counting.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue/#aca1c38278b064f620b6dfc465eb17198"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue/#aca1c38278b064f620b6dfc465eb17198">Refs</a> = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Bitmask of available domains. For an open DomainValue, it is the still</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// possible domains for collapsing. For a collapsed DomainValue it is the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// domains where the register is available for free.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue/#ac900f658d1c226c23057b843aa5df4d0"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue/#ac900f658d1c226c23057b843aa5df4d0">AvailableDomains</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Pointer to the next DomainValue in a chain.  When two DomainValues are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// merged, Victim.Next is set to point to Victor, so old DomainValue</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// references can be updated by following the chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue/#a81594f3b613bebc91349100513f9f0f9"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue/#a765760aae1c271856a0249b1e617e334">DomainValue</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue/#a81594f3b613bebc91349100513f9f0f9">Next</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Twiddleable instructions using or defining these registers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue/#a339c0645a839f644497a7efde4f30cfd"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;MachineInstr &#42;, 8&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/domainvalue/#a339c0645a839f644497a7efde4f30cfd">Instrs</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A collapsed DomainValue has no instructions to twiddle - it simply keeps</span></CodeLine>
